title: India News | Army Builds 150-ft Bridge to Reconnect Border Villages in North Sikkim After Heavy Rains | LatestLY
text: New Delhi, Jun 23 (PTI) Engineers of the Indian Army have built a 150-ft-long suspension bridge over waters in north Sikkim to reconnect villages which got impacted due to heavy rains, a senior official said on Sunday. The bridge was constructed by the engineers of the Trishakti Corps. Also Read | Delhi Shocker: 'Unhappy' With Birth of Twin Girls, Family Kills and Buries Both Infants; Case Registered. The move has come as a respite to locals of these areas which got cut off, a senior official said. Working under challenging conditions, the army engineers reaffirmed their technical proficiency by launching the foot suspension bridge in less than 48 hours over waters flowing at a speed of over 20 knots, the Army official said. The bridge will now pave the way to re-establish connectivity with those areas and facilitate movement of people and provision of relief material to locals, officials said.
